meanings.definition: A play in American football where the ball is downed by the receiving team in their own end zone after a kickoff, resulting in a touchback and the ball being placed at the 25-yard line.
meanings.sent1: During the game, the player made a strategic move by allowing the ball to become touchbacks.
meanings.sent2: The referee signaled a touchback when the ball was downed in the end zone.
meanings.sent3: The fans cheered as the ball rolled into the end zone, leading to touchbacks.
meanings.sent4: In football, touchbacks can change the momentum of the game in an instant.
meanings.sent5: The coach emphasized the importance of preventing touchbacks to the team.
